{{DC Database:Comic Template | Title = Superboy | Image = Superboy Vol 1 7.jpg | Volume = 1 | Issue = 7 | Month = 3 | Year = 1950 | Executive Editor = Whitney Ellsworth | CoverArtist1 = John Sikela | Editor1_1 = Jack Schiff | Writer1_1 = | Penciler1_1 = Wayne Boring | Inker1_1 = Stan Kaye | Colorist1_1 = | Letterer1_1 = | Writer2_1 = Bill Finger | Penciler2_1 = John Sikela | Inker2_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Writer3_1 = William Woolfolk | Penciler3_1 = John Sikela | Inker3_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Quotation = | Speaker = | StoryTitle1 = Around the World with Superboy | Synopsis1 = Doris Faris and Fred Leeds, the winners of the "Why I Like Superboy" contest, are brought to [[Smallville]] with an airport reception headed by Superboy. The Boy of Steel promises to grant their most heartfelt wishes. Doris says she would like to take a round-the-world trip, and Fred wants to see Superboy use all his super-powers. [[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]] combines the two, using his powers on a round-the-world trip on which he takes them. He tells them that there is a puzzle connected with the places they visit, and they deduce it at the end...the first letters of Formosa, Rhodesia, Etah, Donghoi, Dera Bust, Old Faithful, Rio de Janeiro, Iran, and Smallville spell out FRED and DORIS. | StoryTitle2 = Dolls of Danger! | Synopsis2 = [[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]] breaks jail and tries to confound Superboy with a series of doll thefts for his collection, but the Boy of Steel prevails and recaptures him. | StoryTitle3 = The Man Who Knew Superboy's Secret Identity! | Synopsis3 = Reporter Pete Bates thinks he has determined Superboy's secret identity to be Clark Kent from clues left behind in the late curiosity-seeker Rod Rudley's notebook, but Clark manages to convince Bates that he is wrong. | Appearing1 = '''Featured Characters:''' *{{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Other Characters:''' * Doris Faris * Fred Leeds '''Locations:''' * {{a|[[Smallville, Kansas|Smallville]]}} | Appearing2 = '''Featured Characters:''' *{{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Antagonists:''' * {{a|[[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]]}} | Appearing3 = '''Featured Characters:''' *{{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' *
'''Antagonists:''' * Pete Bates {{only}} '''Other Characters:''' *
'''Locations:''' *
'''Items:''' *
'''Vehicles:''' *
| Notes = | Trivia = | Recommended = | Links = }}

{{DC Database:Comic Template | Title = Superboy | Image = Superboy Vol 1 9.jpg | Volume = 1 | Issue = 9 | Month = 7 | Year = 1950 | Executive Editor = Whitney Ellsworth | CoverArtist1 = John Sikela | Editor1_1 = Jack Schiff | Writer1_1 = Edmond Hamilton | Penciler1_1 = John Sikela | Inker1_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Colorist1_1 = | Letterer1_1 = | Writer2_1 = Bill Finger | Penciler2_1 = John Sikela | Inker2_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Writer3_1 = | Penciler3_1 = John Sikela | Inker3_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Quotation = | Speaker = | StoryTitle1 = Superboy's Man of Steel! | Synopsis1 = [[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]] "inherits" a [[robot]] named Percy from Professor Harmon, and the mechanical man's incredible powers and blind devotion prove more hindrance than help. | StoryTitle2 = The Boy Who Stole a Brain! | Synopsis2 = Superboy helps teach an ingenious class cheat a lesson in honesty. | StoryTitle3 = Ship Ahoy, Superboy! | Synopsis3 = [[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]] breaks jail again with the help of a ship, and thus begins thefts of model ships when he starts his crime career anew. Superboy scuttles his schemes and returns him to jail. | Appearing1 = '''Featured Characters:''' *{{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' * Percy the Robot {{Only}} '''Antagonists:''' * Trigger and his gang {{Only}} '''Other Characters:''' * Professor Harmon {{Only}} '''Locations:''' *

{{DC Database:Comic Template | Title = Superboy | Image = Superboy Vol 1 11.jpg | Volume = 1 | Issue = 11 | Month = 11 | Year = 1950 | Executive Editor = Whitney Ellsworth | CoverArtist1 = John Sikela | Quotation = | Speaker = | Editor1_1 = Jack Schiff | Writer1_1 = Bill Finger | Penciler1_1 = John Sikela | Inker1_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Colorist1_1 = | Letterer1_1 = | StoryTitle1 = The Town that was Out of This World | Synopsis1 = When two crooks steal a vial of metal-eating gas, Superboy must prevent anyone from leaving Smallville until he catches the malefactors. | Appearing1 = '''Featured Characters:''' *{{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' * {{a|[[Lana Lang (Earth-One)|Lana Lang]]}} '''Antagonists:''' * Frosty {{only}} '''Other Characters:''' * {{a|[[Jonathan Kent (Earth-One)|Jonathan Kent]]}} * {{a|[[Martha Clark (Earth-One)|Martha Kent]]}} * Professor John Dorman {{Only}} '''Locations:''' * {{a|[[Smallville, Kansas|Smallville]]}} '''Items:''' *
'''Vehicles:''' * | Writer2_1 = | Penciler2_1 = John Sikela | Inker2_1 = Ed Dobrotka | StoryTitle2 = The Pen-Pal Crimes | Synopsis2 = Strange and seemingly worthless "gifts" sent to Superboy from Smallville school's overseas pen-pals lead the Boy of Steel to thwart three crimes in other nations. | Appearing2 = '''Featured Characters:''' * {{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' * Pierre Couton {{Only}} * Johan {{Only}} * Simi {{Only}} * Dirk Kolken {{Only}} '''Antagonists:''' * Raneesi's thieves {{Only}} '''Other Characters:''' *

'''Vehicles:''' *
| Writer3_1 = Don Cameron | Penciler3_1 = Curt Swan | Inker3_1 = John Fischetti | StoryTitle3 = The Famous First Crimes! | Synopsis3 = [[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]] breaks jail again and vows to embarrass Superboy by using famous "firsts" as a theme for his crimes. | Appearing3 = '''Featured Characters:''' * {{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' *

| Notes = * This issue marks Humpty Dumpty's last appearance until 1981's {{c|Superboy Vol 2 24}}. | Trivia = * Also appearing in this issue of ''[[Superboy]]'' was: ** ''Buzzy: "Nature Loves a Nature-Lover"'' (PSA) by [[Jack Schiff]] and [[Win Mortimer]] | Recommended = | Links = }}

{{DC Database:Comic Template | Title = Superboy | Image = Superboy Vol 1 6.jpg | Volume = 1 | Issue = 6 | Month = 1 | Year = 1950 | Executive Editor = Whitney Ellsworth | CoverArtist1 = Al Plastino | Writer1_1 = | Penciler1_1 = John Sikela | Inker1_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Colorist1_1 = | Letterer1_1 = | Editor1_1 = Jack Schiff | Editor1_2 = Mort Weisinger | Writer2_1 = | Penciler2_1 = John Sikela | Inker2_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Colorist2_1 = | Letterer2_1 = | Editor2_1 = Jack Schiff | Editor2_2 = Mort Weisinger | Writer3_1 = | Penciler3_1 = | Inker3_1 = | Colorist3_1 = | Letterer3_1 = | Editor3_1 = Jack Schiff | Editor3_2 = Mort Weisinger | Writer4_1 = | Penciler4_1 = John Sikela | Inker4_1 = Ed Dobrotka | Colorist4_1 = | Letterer4_1 = | Editor4_1 = Jack Schiff | Editor4_2 = Mort Weisinger | Quotation = | Speaker = | StoryTitle1 = The Hobby Robber | Synopsis1 = [[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]], the Hobby Robber, astride a jet-powered rocking horse, commits hobby thefts in [[Metropolis]] and [[Smallville, Kansas|Smallville]] until [[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]] finally brings him down. | StoryTitle2 = Superboy Storekeeper! | Synopsis2 = [[Jonathan Kent (Earth-One)|Jonathan Kent]] sprains his ankle and [[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Clark]] has to substitute for him in the [[Kent General Store]]. During this time he learns of a plot to duplicate a new [[United States of America|U.S.]] secret weapon by enemy agents, and foils it as Superboy. | StoryTitle3 = The Man Who Captured Geronimo | Synopsis3 = | StoryTitle4 = The Hercules of Smallville! | Synopsis4 = When bully Buster Crain tries to make [[Greece|Greek]] immigrant boy Hercules Mafiades perform the legendary labors of [[Herakles (New Earth)|Hercules]] in order to win a part in the school play, [[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy]] lends the new kid a hand and teaches Buster a lesson. | Appearing1 = '''Featured Characters:''' * {{a|[[Kal-El (Earth-One)|Superboy/Clark Kent]]}} '''Supporting Characters:''' *
'''Antagonists:''' * {{a|[[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty (Robert Hobb)]]}} {{1st}} '''Other Characters:''' * Smallville Police Department * {{WP|Croesus|King Croesus}} {{Mentioned}} '''Locations:''' * {{a|[[Metropolis]]}} * {{a|[[Smallville, Kansas|Smallville]]}} '''Items:''' *
'''Vehicles:''' *

| Notes = | Trivia = * [[Robert Hobb (Earth-One)|Humpty Dumpty]] became the first recurring villain of the Superboy feature, returning in issues [[Superboy Vol 1 7|#7]], [[Superboy Vol 1 8|#8]], [[Superboy Vol 1 9|#9]] and [[Superboy Vol 1 11|#11]]. He was revived decades later with the new alias of the [[Curator]] in [[Superboy Vol 2 24|''The New Adventures of Superboy'' #24]]. | Recommended = {{Superman Family RR}} | Links = }} {{Missing Characters}}
